intro: Heracleum pyrenaicum subsp. orsinii, commonly known as the Pyrenean cowparn, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Pyrenees region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its hollow stems and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are large, pinnately compound, and covered with fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into fluffy, dry fruits.
